data.note:
Workflows & Sequences

The 5 Smart Views on the left side of Close make up an entire workflow! This workflow will help you automate your daily activity, such as calling, bulk emailing, and follow-ups.

The workflow here is just an example, so be sure to refer to https://help.close.com/docs/creating-smart-views-for-calling

Import Your Contacts

There are several ways for you to import your data, including migrating from your current CRM, uploading an Excel file and more: https://help.close.com/docs/importing-leads-from-file 

Once your import is complete, all email conversations between your email address and your contacts’ email addresses will be displayed.

Built-In, Unlimited, Worldwide Calling

Your trial is on our Business plan with unlimited incoming and outgoing calls. No setup required. You already have your own dedicated phone line; click on the phone icon in the toolbar to see your phone number.

Click the Call button to make a call, and it will be automatically logged. You can enable Call Recording by clicking the phone icon in the toolbar.

Ready to get started? Test calling Nick.

2-Way Email Sync

Close will pull up historical email conversations with your lead contacts and automatically log sent and received emails. Whether you send an email from your existing email client (Outlook, Gmail, etc.) or from Close, your emails will be logged in Close automatically.

Email histories and tracking only occur for lead contacts in Close that have an email address. Sync your email address under Settings > Your Email Settings.

On Jul 13, 2021, at 06:24 AM, Yuri Cherniaiev <yuri.cherniaiev@airbyte.io> wrote:
Dear Close Team,

We are an Airbyte -- an open source data portability platform which helps users desilo their data across APIs, databases, and warehouses. We're like the open source version of Fivetran. 

We've received requests to build an integration with Close to allow users to pull their Close data via API into analysis & dashboard tools like Redshift, BigQuery, and Looker.

We're happy to build and maintain this integration independently without support from Kustomer; the only thing we'd need is access to an API-enabled Close sandbox account where we can verify that the integration we've built is functional. 

Best, 
Yurii

On Jul 13, 2021, at 06:24 AM, Yuri Cherniaiev <yuri.cherniaiev@airbyte.io> wrote:
Dear Close Team,

We are an Airbyte -- an open source data portability platform which helps users desilo their data across APIs, databases, and warehouses. We're like the open source version of Fivetran. 

We've received requests to build an integration with Close to allow users to pull their Close data via API into analysis & dashboard tools like Redshift, BigQuery, and Looker.

We're happy to build and maintain this integration independently without support from Kustomer; the only thing we'd need is access to an API-enabled Close sandbox account where we can verify that the integration we've built is functional. 

Best, 
Yurii

Best, 
Yurii

Best, 
Yurii
